reviews.review: Un bel spostamento dal fondo del mare alle nuvole di Columbia, non importa se non avete giocato ai titoli precedenti è un bellissimo FPS con elementi anormali consigliatissimo

fps アクション

ちゃんと１週終わらせた記念レビュ

以前レビュー書いたけど
--fpsでやるゲームとして疑問
--テクスチャにオブジェにムラが有りすぎる
とか酷評したけどあれは嘘だ　それでも前作以上にカジュアルな内容ではあると思う
トイレとかメッシュの粗が際立ってる

ストーリーのユーザー置いてけぼり感は相変わらずだけど、シリーズとしてやメタちっくな設定に
一人称ゲーの総括としての、３作品目としてのエンディングはストーリー以上にゲームの構成や
ジャンルの魅力にゲームの中での表現の仕方等　多くの製作者側のメッセージが強くまとめられ
ている　故のストーリーのテンポなのかもしれない

【リプレイ】7
【ゲームバランス】7
【カジュアル】7
【雰囲気】10
【競技性、やり込み】7

I am totally in love with this game.
The story for most captivated me.
really love the art style they chose.
It's is nice and colorful for the most part of the game.
For the games i play it made a nice change.
The puzzles aren't to hard to solve but at times finding something can be hard.
Even when i tried my best to get everything the first time. ( achievement )
Still on my 3rd play through i find stuff i missed.

Pro's

Art style is GORGEOUS
Music ( turned off ) but hey, girls wanna have fun :-D
Maps are made very nicely and when revisited you can see changes
Story is good!
Descently length game, but it that good you want more!
DLC's that i played (story driven ones) short but sweet and worth getting, esp. when you want certain explainations

Con's

Not all PC's might be able to run it properly.
AI not the brightest ( but not all that bad )
At times to much talking during battles by NPC's
One of the best games i've ever played.
Deserves to be GOTY <3

This is art work right here. 10/10 Great FPS, The story is great, the weapons are sick. E1 is really short but has good story that worked well. E2 is amazing it brings everything together or any ? you have about parts of the story and it has some cool new weapons.

Tambem aconselho a jogarem as DLCs Burial at Sea Part 1 e 2!

Das Spiel ist überwiegend positiv, besonders die herausragende maßstäbesetzende Grafik muss man nicht extra erwähnen. Und bei all dem Lob von allen Seiten hier als Abwechslung etwas was mir an dem Spiel überhaupt NICHT gefallen hat:

Was mich sehr früh SEHR STARK gestört hat, waren die unzähligen Dinge die man STÄNDIG einsammeln kann. ÜBERALL und zwar wirklich an den unmöglichsten Stellen und nach jedem Meter und in JEDER Ecke gibt es irgendwas, das man einsammeln kann. Mein persönliches Highlight war eine brennende Frauenleiche, die Munition, Zaubersalze und eine Banane bei sich trug. What the fuck?!! Die gefühlt Hälfte des Spiels habe ich mit Einsammeln von Kram verschwendet. Wenn man später mit Elisabeth unterwegs ist, findet sie auch noch zusätzlich alle zwei Minuten eine Münze die sie einem zuwirft. Und als ob das nicht genug wäre, wird die fantastische Grafik dadurch geschändet, dass in jedem Raum mindest ein Verkaufsautomat steht wo man sich wieder aufpeppen kann. Völlig unnötig. Wie ein Penner geht man an jede Mülltonne ran, weil sich in fast jeder Tonne ein Vermögen verbirgt - also fast wie im echten Leben! Man muss sich einen Kinobesuch vorstellen bei dem ständig um einen herum zahllose Handys ihre Töne ans Ohr schlagen - so ablenkend kamen mir diese Sammelobjhekte vor, als ob man versuchen würde das Spiel absichtlich in die Länge ziehen zu wollen.
Teilweise habe ich versucht mich auf das Level zu konzentrieren und bin absichtlich an allem vorbeigerannt, was man aber leider nicht ganz ignorieren kann, denn schnell geht einem die Munition aus - also muss man wieder in die nächste Bäckerei laufen um Kisten voller Munition hinter den Tresen zu finden! 

Aber die Grafik ist soo schön! Daher trotzdem eine Empfehlung!

This is a fun game. It has great graphics and looks perfect on my HD 27" monitor. This game has very good re-play value. It's one of those games that you will loose track of time and all of a sudden realize you have been playing for hours. I didn't notice any bugs or hickups in it. It's a pleasure to play a game that the developers spent the time and energy to make it work right, look good, and have a storyline that keeps you interested. I highly recommend this game.

Absolutely amazing game. I played it on hard mode until the end fight, at which point i went to normal because I didn't want to wait to figure out how it all ended. I was very confused about the ending to be honest, but being the nerd that I am I went and researched it a bit and quite enjoyed the idea of it.

I will definitely be getting the DLC once I pay my bills (I've been burning through cash because summer...). I've heard they do a fantastic job wrapping up the rest of the story and bridging all of the games together. 

Plus you get to play as Elizabeth who is in my opinion one of the most interesting female protagonists of all time in my opinion.

The base game is pretty good, if a bit easy. The two Burial at Sea episodes are mind-blowingly beautiful, witht the last one being an amazing experience. Every gamer and non-gamer should eperience this!

I will first of all admit, I never played the first Bioshock, and once i played the second (I never do that but it happened this time) I almost was afraid to. The main reason being I loved guarding and protecting the little sisters, for some reason it made me delighted. Bioshock Infinite does pull some of the same heartstrings as Bioshock 2 to me, where as you have a supporting character and the game was made for you to basically love the supporting character to the point that you aren't playing just to beat the game, you are playing because you want what she wants as well. And you'll do whatever it takes to help her. This game puts the Bioshock series into a mind blowing experience that will confuse you in the beginning but the more you play, the more it all starts to make sense, and at a certain point, you are exposed to the truth that all three games are linked. Which I never guessed it. Definitely a great game. I advise it to anyone that loves a thriller that can pull you in and get you hooked to the plot line.

This game is amazing. It's gorgeous, has excellent gameplay and depth as well as an enticing story line. There are many weapons and gear items to choose from as well as the awesome powers that you can upgrade with the use of money and infusions that you pick up whilst on your journeys. I love how it makes use of the eras characteristics with the voxophones, vending machines, history and back stories of the characters as well as other cool things such as the sky lines, sightseers and Elizabeth's Tears. The ending is a bit strange and I think that it didn't give the right feeling of closure but it was still good and as interestingly twisted as the rest of the game. Altogether a really good game, I would recommend it to anyone.
Délicieux côté graphique. Un peu lineaire mais on le sent à peine. Histoire sympathique.
Best game ever.

Pretty great game.  I played it long after its release and the plot was pretty enthralling even though I knew what would happen at the end of the game because I read about it beforehand.  The Burial at Sea DLC episodes are very good as well.
If you love to be highly offended by the racial and religious slurs than this is the game for you. Especially if you hate black people.

This game is nothing like Bioshock or System Shock has more in common with COD or Halo then anything else. Its a overall dumbing down of the entire series.

-Two Weapon Limit

-Regenerating shield garbage that may as well have been full on regenerating health. 

-Linear as Fuck level design.
 
-Really stupid and obtuse plasmid system that puts a two weapon sort of limit on them except not really because you can just open your menu and select a new plasmid (It even pauses the game for you.) that makes you wonder why they didnt just make a numbered or scroll wheel based weapon select like the first and second bioshock instead of making you fiddle around with this stupid menu system. 

-Hacking is downright GONE from the game and so is Gene Tonics, they wont even let you pick the locks on the damn doors.

-Kevin Levine decided to rewrite the plot at the last fucking second from something that could have been really interesting and compelling into a bad Doctor Who episode.

-Laughably simple minded political commentary that has nothing new or interesting to say about nationalism or theism and is insulting to anybody who has studied political ideals religion and history to any significant degree.

-Has an annoying fanbase who (like Spec Ops) claims that the game is "deep" when It is about as deep as puddle in terms of both gameplay and story. Hell compared to this game Spec Ops is the most subtle and "deep" game ever in comparison.

Just go buy System Shock 2 or even Bioshock 1 or 2. They are way better then this overrated tripe.

2013 年 Steam 聖誕特賣，BioShock Triple Pack 出現在特價列表中，衝著《生化奇兵：無限》美輪美奐的畫面以及Metacritic的高分，便買下來玩了。

進入遊戲之後，畫面果真沒讓人失望，壯麗的哥倫比亞諸多場景著實讓人驚艷，搭配上骨董留聲機傳出的老歌，原本以為我就會在這風和日麗的天空之城殺殺敵人救救小伊莉莎白，再一次體驗已經在其他遊戲體驗無數次的英雄救美。沒想到全破的當下，我卻盯著製作團隊名單呆坐在電腦螢幕前，內心激動不已...

自此，心目中的遊戲神作清單又記上了一筆。

Put simply, it's not that fun. If you were expecting gameplay like Bioshock 1 or 2, you'll be disappointed. It tries to be some sort of Halo run-and-gun, and lacks any of the depth that the first two games had. Combat, even at the highest difficulty, is way too easy and doesn't have much complexity.

The DLC is also awful. The gameplay is even more boring than the core game - though half of the DLC is spent standing around in elevators listening so fortunately you don't have much to play. The story is at least somewhat interesting to see how it ties the games together.
úžasné :3
Великолепно! Хороший геймплей, завораживающие пейзажи, гениальный сюжет. Достоинства игры настолько велики, что на маленькие недочёты глаза закрываются сами. В остальном – must play.
mean!

Bioshock Infinite by 2K Games, where to begin where to begin?

First off ill start by saying this game is by far the best of the bioshock games to date (in my opinion at least) disregarding the fact that it is an entirely different universe of the bioshock franchise and has little ties story wise to the previous games it in itself is a true masterpiece aside from an overly religious feeling, that i would play over and over without boredom.

The game follows a man by the name of Booker Dewitt who is sent by debt collectors to kidnap a girl named Elizabeth from the city in the sky Columbia, however this game leads him down a path lies, twists and turns that makes you question everything at the end.
The story itself is very thought provocative, clever and twisty while including some very outstanding and memorable characters making it one of the best stories in a game that i have played in a long time.

The controls, and general playability is pretty much the same as previous bioshocks, you get your plasmids (or vigors in this games case) and you guns, your upgradable weapons and abilities, and your collectibles, the only thing now is you have Elizabeth who will find you ammo, salts, and health whilst in the midst of battle.

Aside from all that i honestly cannot find or think of anything about or in this game that would flaw or deter one from playing it, i can say without a doubt that this game is worth every last cent and i highly recommend it!

Incredible story that will leave your head split open. A lot of replay value, even if it's only to better understand the story and its subtle references. Everyone who plays the main story should play the DLC. It has even more twists and brings the first Bioshock to life.
Visually stunning, cool story but completely linear.

A great story, not too hard, not too easy. It is a lot of fun. The characters are great, and it doesn't feel like one giant escort mission. In fact, I think the character you are escorting for most of the game makes it better in a lot of ways.

Одна из немногих современных игр, которая смогла увлечь меня. После проходжения основной сюжетной линии осталось множество впечатлений и эмоций, а прохождение двух сюжетных DLC (особенно Episode Two) лишь усилило их. Конечно в некоторых местах игра не дотягивала до своего уровня и их хотелось поскорее пробежать, но большую часть прохождения просто дух захватывает от всего что происходит на экране монитора. Единственное что остаётся для меня загадкой, так это решение разработчиков "Закольцевать" серию, закончить тем, чем начиналался первый BioShock. Искренне надеюсь на продолжении приключений Букера и Элизабет, хотя знаю что этому не бывать....

Bioshock Infinite is an experience I will remember for a long time. It’s ability to build upon and create a likeable and believable universe is astounding. Infinite isn’t like its predecessors, rather it is more of an Action Shooter than a Stealth Shooter. The player of this game when playing isn’t restricted as much and you don’t have to do any menial scrounging of supplies off of the ground and in objects. Scrounging is always advantageous but in this game it isn’t emphasized as much as it was in Bioshock and Bioshock 2. 

Gameplay: Gameplay is unfortunately brought down by the fact that it often feels like a run of the mill shooter. I often found myself using at most two vigors that were available rather than using all of them in certain situations as the two vigors did all that I needed in the game. I also was irritated by the fact that you are unable to carry more than two weapons at a time unlike the original Bioshock in which the player would collect weapons and store ammo for each switching to whichever was the best tool for the job at the time. I often found myself using most of the weapons because each felt that it had an impact even if it didn’t have all the upgrades that you can add to the weapons in the game. Movement is fluid and the objectives are often easy to follow because of the player being funneled in one direction throughout the game. The gameplay isn’t revolutionary, it isn’t even evolutionary, but it is enjoyable to play even with the lack thereof. 

Story: Here is a moot point about the game. The story, from my perspective, was endearing and harshe at the right moments. It drew me in and I often found myself playing for a couple hours because of how likeable the story was; that could be a problem for some because the previous games in the series were all well told through narration of other characters and the person you played felt like yourself allowing for the games to be more immersive. In Bioshock Infinite you play the role of a defined character, Booker Dewitt, who has background and isn’t your usual masked and silent protagonist. If Booker wants to say something he will and you will hear it. Booker and Elizabeths interactions, I feel, add to the game in a manner that was appealing. The story progresses in a believable and cohesive manner, even for a game with strange concepts, and ends leaving the player to think about what just really happened. Games that make you think about what you just went through at the end are my favorite types of games. 

Soundtrack: The game’s soundtrack is enjoyable and has quite a few memorable tracks but felt too far in the background. I don’t tweak with most of the volume settings when I first playthrough a game, as to make the game as close to what the designers wanted it to look, feel, and sound like, but the soundtrack just felt behind the scenes and not really an emphasis in the game. I have listened to a couple tracks that were enjoyable from the game and there are a few gems in it, but more often than not you will hear the chords of combat and the grinding of strings when combat ends and that is about it. Cinematics have their own music that blends and adds to the experience but I felt that the soundtrack should have been more in the foreground than the background in the game. 

Pros
- Enjoyable story
- Linear shooter done right
- A polished game that looks remarkable
- Made me think at both the end of the main game and the DLC expansion.

Cons
- Isn’t Evolutionary or Revolutionary in any manner
- Doesn’t have much of the gameplay from its predecessors

The game is a well rounded shooter and has a great story to go along with it. If you have around ten hours to blow this game will be memorable experience.

I would give the game a 7/10

This game is amazing and everything i was hoping from it!  I purchased this game wondering if it was worth it. Wow! I just finished my first sort of speedy play through of this and I am impressed! Walking around this world was amazing enough, once the action started I was hooked until the end. Combat did get a little grindy after a while but once you learn how to deal with your enemies quickly it shouldn't be an issue. Elizabeth was a great companion throughout the game and having someone there to cough up those items you need but can't seem to find at a given moment is a nice addition to gameplay, even though it does seem like a pretty large crutch at times. I'm sure there's hours more of content to be seen and with my next playthrough on a higher difficulty I plan to see exactly how much exploring there is to be done!

Bioshock Infinite translates all the moral themes and worldly isolation that the original two Bioshock games did, while still bringing something new to the table. I have beaten this game six times, and every playthrough I still find something new to enhance the storytelling. Gameplay is smooth, and the combination of vigors and weapons (although you have been downgraded from the full arsenal to only carrying two weapons at any given time) make combat a delight every time. Despite my initial fears, Bioshock Infinite delivered a story and gameplay experience equal to the first in the series, shocking twist ending and all. 10/10.

This game is great. It's gameplay is pretty good (not amazing though) and through most of the game the story seems straightforward and normal... Until the end. The ending is amazing. I don't want spoil anything so I'll leave at that

Прошел игру на одном дыхании и не жалею о потраченном времени. Закрученный сюжет, на переваривание которого мне пришлось потратить время, большое количество противников и милашка-спутница помогут вам весело провести пару свободных вечеров.

Однозначно одна из лучших игр 2013 года. Графика - потрясающая, дизайнеры сделали просто невероятно красивый город, парящий в небе. Геймплей тоже сделан на высоком уровне.Однако есть и минус - к середине прохождения игра становится однообразна и перестает удивлять, начинает однообразно заставлять игрока просто бегать по локациям и убивать всех подряд противников. Моя оценка 4 из 5. Именно из-за однообразия. В целом, если перетерпеть моменты однообразия игра покажется очень интересной в плане сюжета.

The rest of the game is good, it becomes a generic shooter with some interisting mechanics and good controls. The story is also good.

A layman's understanding of quantum mechanics mixed with pure science fantasy prevents a cohesive narrative from forming. Gameplay is classic Bioshock. Moral and political beliefs and questions are also classic Bioshock. The game repetitively informs the viewer about the impossibility of choice from a multiverse viewpoint, then lets us make choices which only have cosmetic effects.

tl;dr if you like Bioshock series, play it. If you need plot, avoid it.

Bhè che dire di questo giocone, anzi, da dove partire? Per prima cosa tengo subito a dire che a mio parere se non hai giocato i capitoli vecchi non puoi capire certe cose..."Ma che cavolo dici?" "Ma ti sei drogato?" Commenti che tanto so già di aspettarmi... Ma tornando al nostro fantastico gioco...

-Da dove partire davvero? Sicuramente dei miglioramenti in qualità di grafica ci sono stati, eccome se ci sono stati, colori molto più accesi; ma sopratutto mi ha colpito il fatto dell'accuratezza del riflesso della luce sulle armi o tutto ciò che fosse in metallo, in certi casi eccessivo, ma al minimo spiraglio di luce riflesso assicurato...

-Avanziamo oltre e parliamo dei dialoghi...ben strutturati a mio parere e curati, sopratutto durante il "gameplay di esplorazione" dove Elizabeth farà dei commentini;sicuramente niente da togliere ai combattimenti (senza tralasciare nulla ai buon vecchi dialoghi dei capitoli precedenti).

-I nemici:che dire di loro...mi sono molto piaciuti e non, perchè approvo il fatto che ci siano come delle "bande" o comunque gruppi di persone che la pensano in modo diverso, ma vorremmo mettere di combattere contro dei mazzi scellerati su una cazzo di isaola volante??? Si butterebbo sicuramente giù da soli xD (e per pazzi intendi i buon vecchi riconbinanti)

-Armi: mi sono molto piaciute le nuove armi introdotte e rimodificate alcune di quelle vecchie in meglio.

-Continuiamo a parlare con i plasmidi...alcuni nuovi, altri riperfezionati dai vecchi...E su questa cosa vorrei aprire una parentesi ...onestamente definirei il modo di assunzione dei plasmidi come un contro, perchè a me non è andato tanto giù il fatto che si assumi l'eve in un modo pietoso...IN BOTTIGLIETTE!!!!

-Tralasciando questa sclerata vorrei concludere subito di parlare del gioco normale (perchè per il resto è fantastico in tutto e per tutto e quotandolo 8.5-9/10) e iniziare a parlare dei tanto discussi DLC Burial at Sea....(i futuri ragionamenti potrebbero contenere spoiler...se lo leggi e ti sfavi perchè sai cose che non volevi sapere allora perchè ca..o lo leggi?)

+Burial at Sea Part 1:................................................una cag..a totale...il mio gatto non avrebbe saputo fare di peggio dopo un'indigestione di 1 settimana, ma tornando al gioco...Si ok! Ti vengono spiegate delle cose riguardo alla fine del gioco normale o comunque riguardo ai personaggi del gioco, ma per il resto equivale a fare qualche missione in più... Non ci sono novità se non nella trama e nell'aggiunta di un'arma che sembra un'antenna di Sky portatile per tostare il pane...Solo per il DLC Part 1 Voto 2-2.5/10

+Burial at Sea Part 2:Per me è veramente difficile parlare di questo DLC...All'inizio mi ha veramente colpito il fatto di usare durante il gioco solo Elizabeth, però allo stesso tempo con il proseguire mi ha fatto sfavare riguardo a certe cose...
-1In questa parte Elizabet può usare armi per combattere ed in più ha una fottuta e fighissima balestra con 3 tipi di dardi...La mia domanda è: Per quale ca..o di motivo non combatti anche nel gioco normale?? Una soluzione mi è poi saltata in mente...Lei non è l'Elizabeth che noi abbiamo conosciuto nel gioco...
-2 Il fatto di "dover" giocare in modalità stealth, perchè i cattivi sono molto forti e ti possono tranquillamente togliere la vita in qualche petosecondo è stata una cosa buona, però strutturata poi nel gameplay in maniera orrenda; in alcuni casi se passi davanti ai nemici essi non ti cagano, e quindi diventano facili prede...
-3 Stile di combattimento riguardante alle armi...Posso capire che sei una ragazza fragile Elizabeth, ma mi spieghi per quale assurdo motivo non puoi portare più di 4 munizioni per il fucile a canne mozze??? (2 caricate e 4 di scorta) Oppure dei dardi per balestra, 4 di un tipo e 2-3 di quell'altro...O meglio ancora come nella parte 1 la riaggiunta dell'arma che sembra un tostapane...
-4 Stile di combattimento riguardante i plasmidi: ebbene si ragazzi, avete letto bene anche prima riguardo al fatto di usare solo Elizabeth, con i plasmidi; a mio parere penso sia stata la vera cagata del DLC (si ok è un'innovazione, ma è pur sempre una cagata)...
-5 La trama invece nulla da ridire...mi ha veramente colpito dritto al cuore a partire da tutta la storia del primo Bioshock a questo capitolo finale...

In conclusione queste due parti sono da comprare se volete averle e volete giocarle voi a tutti i costi (consiglio spassionato, comprate il season pass in sconto), mentre se volete risparmiare qualche soldo e preferite guardarvi il gameplay su you tube, fate pure, tanto in qualità di gioco non ci perdete nulla... Part 2 Voto 5.5-6/10 solo per la trama e in aggiunta un 2-3/10 per il gioco

One of the best single player games I've played.  Great story, characters, graphics, and gameplay, this game has it all.  I've played through multiple times on console and PC and still looking forward to my next playthrough.  Highly recommend this game to everyone!

My personal favorite of the bioshock series! I loved the weapons and the characters and the plot is fantastic! I have played it through many times and loved it more each time. My only probablem with it is that it has very little conection to the previous bioshocks... But it is still a fantastic game!

I bough it during the summer sales and let me tell  you. This game was absolutely amazing, The plot twists in the game and DLC made me speechless I would reccomend however buying this game on sale and the season pass which is what I did. What made me even happier was because they re-optimized the game to function better on low end PCs and my PC is as low end as it get and the game ran smoothly and still looked beautiful.
Finished the game in one day, best day ever

La realidad no me esperaba juego tan bueno. me encantaron los graficos. la historia buenisima la idea de usar mundos paralelos en un juego quedo muy bien. El final te muestra como une el mundo del los bioshock anteriores. Generalizo todo diciendo que es genial el juego

This looks like a good game and I have enjoyed playing what I've managed to play so far.  If you've played the previous Bioshocks, I'm pretty sure you'll like this.  The gun play is an improvement on the last games, doing away with the wheel evey time you want to change weapon or power which rather ruined the flow of the game in the prequels.  Looks pretty fancy too.  HOWEVER, and it's a big HOWEVER, in the 7 hours I've been playing, I've had about 7 crashes the latest of which currupted my save game file.  If you decide to go with it, best of luck
I'm a fan of the series. The story gets a little far out there in infinite, but it was still really good.

It's hard to describe this game, it's poetical in a way, a lot of things spoken I hardly understand. Shooting is minor matter, I love the scenery of the early 1900s, the graphic is outstanding! A fascinating scary feeling is latent present all through the game. Not for nothing the metascore is nearly 100!
Fantastisches Spiel, das mit einer wahnsinnigen Story überzeugen kann.
fab
this game is so fun, the story is really well put together, and i hope theres a fourth one!

Ok - if you're going to buy this game for the sake of the gunplay and the story, then give it a miss. You could write a story like this. It's not really a biggie. Unless you're mentally retarded or <18. 

But if you want to buy this game for the sake of knowing why the fuck people freaked the hell out about it on launch, as well as for the cool environments and the characters, as well as the ability to summon crows and be the king of crows and kill everything with crows and then kill more things with crows and crows are awesome. 

TL;DR there is some immagination, and I like the ideas, but the core gameplay is shallow and the story is paced in the same way that a chicken paces the ground. Clucking and bobbing all over the place in fits. Is it worth the price tag? Noooooooooo.

Pros: 
-Art Direction

Cons:
-Everything else

This Bioshock Infinite has a linear obvious history.
Besides, no hacking system, no big daddies, no little sisters, no bots, lack of enemies classes, characters are not psycho, the scenario is not dark, lack of tonics, half of the plasmids are horrible.... and much more
This is a great game. FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!
el mejor...8 grafica ... 9 giocabilita...10 solo per il finale

Good fun. Replay? I don't think so.

Amazing visuals, insane action and combat, lifelike AI and voice acting, some language and possibly disturbing themes.
